---
title: GAD-7 vs De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale
---

## GAD-7 vs De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale

In the field of psychology, there are various tools and measures used to assess psychological health, such as the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale. These two scales are often used in tandem to assess an individuals overall psychological health, with focus on the level of anxiety they are experiencing, and their feeling of loneliness respectively. However, a comparison of these two scales, namely GAD-7 vs De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale, can be a time-consuming and subjective task.

{{< card heading="Try Harmony" copy="Compare GAD-7 and De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale " url="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app" >}}

{{< youtube cEZppTBj1NI >}}

Harmony, a software developed for psychologists, simplifies this task. With its advanced natural language processing and generative AI models, Harmony is proficient in harmonising questionnaire items from different scales such as GAD-7 and De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale. Moreover, it caters to multiple languages, expanding its scope of utility. By using Harmony, researchers can get a percentage match between each item in GAD-7 vs De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale, streamlining the task and providing a more objective comparison. Harmony allows for a time-efficient and objective assessment and comparison of psychological scales, hence it is an excellent choice for comparing GAD-7 vs De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale. It not only simplifies the comparison process, but also allows for inter-studies comparisons leading to a comprehensive understanding of the responses in relation to changing social conditions. Hence, Harmony proves invaluable for psychologists and researchers in achieving accurate, reliable, and expedited results.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
